intro: Scorzonera yemensis, commonly known as the Yemen scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick, fleshy leaves that store water. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scorzonera yemensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
